body_html:
it's weird since the errors come in way before the dependency issue we're getting in the previous set of errors.

I have nmed libmkldnn.so to confirm that the functions that were being caught as undefined references in my original error were indeed baked inside that shared object, so maybe somewhere along the way, Caffe2 isn't picking up that libmkldnn.so file? I definitely have it in /usr/local/lib

I have nmed libmkldnn.so to confirm that the functions that were being caught as undefined references in my original error were indeed baked inside that shared object, so maybe somewhere along the way, Caffe2 isn't picking up that libmkldnn.so file? I definitely have it in /usr/local/lib
body:
it's weird since the errors come in way before the dependency issue we're getting in the previous set of errors.

I have `nm`ed `libmkldnn.so` to confirm that the functions that were being caught as undefined references in my original error were indeed baked inside that shared object, so maybe somewhere along the way, Caffe2 isn't picking up that `libmkldnn.so` file? I definitely have it in `/usr/local/lib`
